definition: to leak/to divulge/to leave out by mistake/waterclock or hourglass (old)

sentences.english: The authorities need to prevent tax fraud.
sentences.chinese: 当局需要措施防止偷税漏税。

sentences.english: In the case of tax dodging, the results were even more striking.
sentences.chinese: 对于逃漏税的问题，测试结果甚至更为突显。

sentences.english: The government has revised the penalties for tax evasion.
sentences.chinese: 政府已修订逃漏税的罚则。

sentences.english: Muslim Activist's Son Sentenced to Prison in China for Tax Evasion.
sentences.chinese: 穆斯林活动人士之子被以偷漏税被判刑。

sentences.english: Tax evasion is also a crime.
sentences.chinese: 偷税漏税也是一种犯罪。

sentences.english: As tax season approaches this year, even more people may  resort to cheating.
sentences.chinese: 今年的报税季节将近，以致更多的人会选择偷税漏税。

sentences.english: It seems that some doctors doctor their accounts in order to avoid paying taxes.
sentences.chinese: 好象有些医生为了偷税漏税而篡改账目。

sentences.english: Mr Papaconstantinou promises that “we will put people in jail for tax evasion”.
sentences.chinese: 帕帕康斯坦丁努承诺将“把偷税漏税的人送进监狱”。

sentences.english: Those who evade tax will be punished by the law.
sentences.chinese: 偷税漏税者将受到法律制裁。

sentences.english: Mr Papaconstantinou promises that "we will put people in jail for tax evasion".
sentences.chinese: 帕帕康斯坦丁努承诺将“把偷税漏税的人送进监狱”。

sentences.english: As tax season approaches this year, even more people may resort to cheating.
sentences.chinese: 今年的报税季节将近，以致更多的人会选择偷税漏税。

sentences.english: Enhancing the law enforcement efforts to crack down on tax evasion.
sentences.chinese: 增强执法力度，严厉打击偷漏税行为。

sentences.english: Perhaps China will also consider cracking down on tax evasion.
sentences.chinese: 也许中国还将考虑打击偷税漏税的行为。

definition: to pay a tax one has evaded/to pay an overdue tax
to refuse to pay taxes/to boycott taxes
to file an income tax return/to declare dutiable goods (at customs)
to smuggle/to have an illicit affair
